oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tompall Glaser Interviewed by Bob Allen
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Tompall Glaser being interviewed by Bob Allen. The interview takes place on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tompall Glaser
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (2:08) -- Skip to 2:08, first part of tape contains loud club noises. Difficult to decipher speaking through background band noise. Bob Allen tries to interview Tompall Glaser. (14:16) -- Tompall Glaser tells a story about kicking a stool at a place called the Speakeasy. (15:44) -- Tompall Glaser speaks about the difficulty of finding a great song or artist. (16:05) -- Tompall Glaser speaks about his personal financial success. (16:55) -- Tompall Glaser speaks about not wanting to own artists' desires. (18:33) -- Tompall Glaser speaks about being embarrassed about certain parts of the outlaw movement. (21:35) -- Tompall Glaser mentions Tom T. Hall's lifestyle. (22:11) -- Interview interruption.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Glaser, Tompall;
